30_19sggoAZ4hcorrrfWoFWP9rwfpVsL29cnZ.body:
> [rebroad](#comment_1_1HPbpjy6zYnrGYmvm7Pvza4KC4ADewTzYE): what is the reason for an alternative version of ZeroNet?

Maybe it will have better performance, also it's just nice to have more than one implementation to not stuck in a monopoly. Probably they can invent some new features which first be experimental and only in their variant, but if they work nice and people like them, other implementations will take the inspiration and do the same. One example of such feature is i2p transport.
